Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/209.242.141.25|209.242.141.25]] ([[User talk:209.242.141.25|talk]]) ([[Wikipedia:Administrators|admins]]: [[Special:Blockip/209.242.141.25|block]]) to last version by 141.154.226.200
it's preposterous to state that there's little agreement among historians. there's a lot of agreement.
Change of date with the development of the fsacist program (1921 changed 1919 in the heading In 1921 [1919] the fascists developed...
Restore accurate text backed by cites

-There is little agreement among historians, political scientists, and other scholars concerning the exact nature of fascism, although since the 1990's there has been a growing move toward consensus r
there is in fact little agreement, as evidenced by the disputes on this page
not true that there's little agreement on what fascism is. there is a lot of agreement.
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/72.232.20.146|72.232.20.146]] ([[User talk:72.232.20.146|talk]]) to last version by Ihcoyc
gave the Hegelian connection greater prominence and clarity
leaders are not administrations, a country under a leader is.
corrected use of wrong prepositions, corrected spelling
this is not true. there is a lot of agreement about what fascism is.
every state that has ever existed? that's absurd.
made sentence make a little more meaningful
Restore comments on early fascism. This is well borne out by citations below.
rm disputed assertions that belong in the definition section; what is "early fascism"?
/* Mussolini's influences */ added mention of futurism here
/* Definition */ Hannah Arendt a Marxist? Well, I guess there are people who think FDR was one...
/* Mussolini's Fascism */ How can one say ''Rerum Novarum'' is "against fascism" when it predates fascism by over two decades?
/* Definition */ rm unencyclopedic material and a mis-paraphrase of Mussolini
fixed some POV-pushing; opposition to individualism is already noted and appeals to altruism are by no means unique to fascist leaders
moved text for continuity and added link
add better lead text with the magic word "collective"
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/67.185.120.202|67.185.120.202]] ([[User talk:67.185.120.202|talk]]) to last version by Delldot

rm an incomprehensible addition and a stray character
rm duplication; copy edit a recent addition; embedded quotation marks use single quotes
inserted short but alarmingly absent discussion of fascist machismo as defining element. C'mon folks, I'm NOT a woman and yet even I can tell that this is being written by and for men only
Fascism in has expressed itself?? Also, it's Salò, not Salo
/* Neo-Fascism */ Rm link to a section of an article, where the article is already linked.
Intro overhaul of Sam Spade "quasi"-reverted: too much subtle right-wing guilt is betrayed in all those "socialisms" and "idiotic lumpenproles"
An awful lot of definition has slowly crept into the lead. Refactoring. Nothing substantive dropped.
Fascism attracted political support from diverse sectors of the population, including [[big business]], [[farmers]] and [[landowner]]s, [[nationalism|nationalists]], and [[reactionary|reactionaries]]

do not remove notices, please discuss changes with the community first
rv - no talk page discussions, no edit summaries (my good faith doesn't go that far)
Why only "some" conservatives? The complicity of conservative politicians was crucial to the rise of Hitler (von Papen etc.), and he was opposed by some people in many of the other groups cited
in lead: rm "unfortunately" (pure POV); other small edits including fixing many weird links. De-emphasize conservatives; add (as secondary) owners of small businesses

removed a duplicated sentence (i.e. a typo)
Added contemporary perspective of origins of fascism.

Demeaning those who don't agree with you by using diminutions is not acceptable. Many are aware of Fascism's outgrowth of Socialist politics. Some aren't.

/* Differences */ fix spelling, without necessarily endorsing the use here of "especially"
"...a century tending to the right, a Fascist century" - seems pretty clear to me
i agree that mussolini's fascism is right wing, but he doesnt say it's right wing.
/* See also */ already linked in the intro
fine. note that this is mussolini's pov.
what? absurd - and what happened to not defining fascism as Mussolini wanted?
revert to Bryan Nguyen. Add other things if you want, but the contrast to individualism is the most important definitional aspect according to Mussolini.
fascism is opposed to many things; gave a short list
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/64.12.116.68|64.12.116.68]] ([[User talk:64.12.116.68|talk]]) to last version by Icemountain
revert the last edit. intro was deleted, etc.
removed elipsis ..sentence doesnt continue on in text
fascism is in opposition to individualism. don't delete. see talk. this is foundational to fascism.
/* See also */ it's common knowledge that fascism is anti-individualism
rv to rm [[Individualism]] additions (both tangential and lacking [[WP:CITE]])
replaced the economic aspect of fascism, this time with qualifier
this depends on your definition (Pinochet is often called a fascist)

don't forget the economic aspect of fascism

never say this kind of thing in an encyclopedia article. It tells the reader "we're so clueless we can't figure out what it means" ..take a stand one way or the other.
No agreement on general definition - go to talk
/* External links */ Economic Fascism by Thomas DiLorenzo
/* General */ *[[Alfred Sohn-Rethel]] ''Economy and Class Structure of German Fascism'',London, CSE Bks, 1978 ISBN 0906336007
rv No consensus yet. Go to talk.
Revert: no agreement - go to talk
rearanged to make more coherent - but additions are useful
reduced needless detail & moved to "fascism and ideology"
those who consider fascism equivalent to corporatism
Kolko not a libertarian - corporatism much to complicated for toss off mention
ironically, that's precisely the view that figures most prominently in the intro right now... I'll go look for citations, though I daresay all you have to do is google "fascism"
Sorry, Mihnea, I'm usually with you but this is uncited and, I think, false. I don't believe that MOST on the right say that fascism is leftist.
toned down statement; hopefully you will find this more acceptable
rm uncited claim that each contemporary political ideology attempts to define "fascism" as the opposite of its own views
I believe that sentence is particularly important; if you oppose it, please discuss
kept the controversial statements, but removed the qualifier "majority view"
cite works if you wish to support your argument; name-dropping is of little use
rv. I believe Payne, Griffin, Eatwell, Fritzsche, Laqueur, Laclau, & Reich, not the previous editor.
"the majority view is that fascism as a social movement employs elements from the political left" - plainly false
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/70.189.174.9|70.189.174.9]] ([[User talk:70.189.174.9|Talk]]) to last version by Hogeye
/* Notes */ rm note, since material was removed
/* Definition */ specify New Deal is WWI era
rm unnecessary "in fact" & copy edit a recent addition; rm mischaracterization of a link
"problem of" is correct here, not "problem with"; rm uncited "However , this doctrine was never really applied in practice in italy."
von Mises, Flynn, and von Hayek are serious scholars, and not all who share their views are conservative or economists
rewrote to reduce sweeping and dubious claims and reflect contemporary research trends
rewrote with cites the dispute over right or left and put in perspective
mv second dictionary definition down so that fascio etymology comes first, current dictionaries discussed together
Cleanup needed because first paragraph is too verbose
reworked intro to emphasize the controversy
not sure "agents" is the correct term, broadened the description of people who supported Fascism
/* Mussolini's Fascism */ add image of Mussolini
mv wiktionary template down to bottom
Christian sections now under "Fascism and religion" with a brief header. Minor tidying, rm more over-wikifying
Massive copyedit, trim lead, referencing, re-arrange paragraphs, integrated and rm some links, bolding of explicit cross-references. Please review.
fringe views should not be be over-represented
Attributing arguments about fascism to actual people, per [[WP:CITE]] and [[WP:AWT]]. Rm some redundancies, overwikifying. A lot more work to be done.
